title: Teenager fronts Wollongong Court accused of assaulting a father and posting videos to Snapchat
text:
A teenager has fronted court after allegedly posting a series of Snapchat videos showing a bloodied 57-year-old father.

Casey Holmes appeared in Wollongong Local Court, south of Sydney, on Tuesday accused of assaulting Brad Quirk on Saturday September 28.

A series of her Snapchat videos were shared to social media, allegedly showing the 18-year-old laugh about the injuries she inflicted on Mr Quirk at William Woodward Park near Thirroul Train Station.

Casey Holmes (centre) appeared in Wollongong Local Court, south of Sydney, on Tuesday for allegedly assaulting Brad Quirk on Saturday September 28

A series of her Snapchat videos were shared to social media, allegedly showing the 18-year-old laugh about the alleged injuries she inflicted on Mr Quirk (pictured) at William Woodward Park near Thirroul Train Station

They went viral on Facebook in the wake of the alleged assault and Holmes was charged with assault occasioning actual bodily harm and affray on October 1.

Mr Quirk, who is without his glasses and has blood on his face, is seen stumbling in the footage.

In the video, a woman addresses the camera and says: 'This is pretty random but I f***d this c*** up because he was looking at me'.

To the alleged victim she says: 'Can I take a photo of your face? Look it's bleeding, that's from me.'

Police will allege in court the victim was sitting on a park bench about 8.45pm when Holmes assaulted him and her friend watched on.

Holmes's case was briefly mentioned on Tuesday morning but has been adjourned until November.

The 18-year-old, who has not yet entered a plea, accused media of 'harassment' as she left the court, the Illawarra Star reported.

Mr Quirk's daughter Ellyce previously told Daily Mail Australia the incident was an alleged 'random attack'.

'My dad is okay thank god,' she said.

'He has cuts on his cheek and eyebrow and a bruised eye. He also has sore ribs but he is okay.'

Ellyce said her father can 'barely' see without his glasses and his vision would have been blurry during the alleged altercation.

'Anyone who knows my dad knows how harmless he is,' she said.

'I am so upset that they can do this to a 57-year-old man, let alone anyone.'
